name: Leadership
definition: The ability to inspire, guide, and empower individuals and teams toward achieving shared goals while fostering a positive, inclusive, and accountable environment.
description: Effective leadership extends beyond formal authority; it involves establishing a clear vision, making strategic decisions, and motivating others to excel. It requires the capacity to build trust, develop talent, navigate uncertainty, and align individual efforts with organizational success.

1.title: Emerging
behaviors: Leads by example through reliability, integrity, and a positive attitude.
Takes initiative to solve problems within their own scope without waiting for direction.
Supports new team members by sharing knowledge and offering assistance.
Accepts responsibility for own actions and learns from mistakes.

2.title: Competent
behaviors: Delegates tasks effectively, matching assignments to team membersâ€™ strengths.
Provides timely, actionable feedback to help others improve performance.
Translates team goals into clear, actionable steps and timelines.
Facilitates collaboration and resolves minor conflicts within the team.

3.title: Proficient
behaviors: Translates high-level organizational strategy into operational plans for the department.
Champions diversity and inclusion, ensuring varied perspectives are valued.
Navigates change management effectively, keeping the team focused during transitions.
Builds strong cross-functional partnerships to remove roadblocks for the team.

4.title: Visionary
behaviors: Sets the innovative long-term vision and culture for the organization.
Develops a pipeline of future leaders by mentoring senior managers and directors.
Makes high-stakes, complex decisions with incomplete information and manages the associated risks.
Inspires enterprise-wide commitment and resilience during times of crisis or major transformation.
